title: Venezuela: 50 Entrepreneurs Benefit from Citi Microloan Program
summary: Last Tuesday, February 11, Nelson Acosta, President of Citibank N.A., Sucursal Venezuela and Mary Gloria Olivo, General Director of the civil association Fomento del Desarrollo Popular (FUDEP), awarded 237,600.00 bolívars in microloans to 50 low-income female heads of household participating in the corporate social responsibility "Financial Education for Life" initiative.
tag-1: Venezuela: 50 Entrepreneurs Benefit from Citi Microloan Program
tag-3: Last Tuesday, February 11, Nelson Acosta, President of Citibank N.A., Sucursal Venezuela and Mary Gloria Olivo, General Director of the civil association Fomento del Desarrollo Popular (FUDEP), awarded 237,600.00 bolívars in microloans to 50 low-income female heads of household participating in the corporate social responsibility "Financial Education for Life" initiative.
tag-4: The aim of the project is to reduce the financial vulnerability of entrepreneurs in communities around the country by providing them with education that strengthens their capacity to manage money. It also includes access to credit for starting or improving their own businesses.
tag-5: "This project empowers entrepreneurs with the skills for managing their businesses responsibly and making efficient use of their resources," the President of Citi Venezuela, Nelson Acosta, noted. "Since it began, the program has benefited more than 2,570 entrepreneurs, most of them women, and awarded 6,465 loans at competitive rates. We are proud to contribute to improving the quality of life of beneficiaries and their families, and of the positive impact we have had in their communities."
tag-6: "To start a business you need the initiative to formalize your ideas and set them in motion," María Montero, a project beneficiary in the state of Carabobo, commented. "Thanks to the Financial Education workshops, I learned to be more organized in keeping daily ledgers, filing receipts and keeping inventory up to date. I have been able to save money and improve my family's quality of life."
tag-7: FUDEP's General Director, Mary Gloria Olivo, stressed the importance of providing women with the financing and training they need to make their businesses a success in the short, medium and long terms: "Our entrepreneurs receive training in such areas as calculating and projecting investments, costs, returns and earnings; inventory control; creating a budget; business ethics; and customer service, as well as the laws and standards that regulate microentrepreneurial activity," she maintained.

tag-11: FUDEP FUDEP is a nonprofit civil association whose mission is to promote social development in Venezuela. FUDEP has more than 20 years of experience in fomenting improved quality of life for the majority and promoting citizenship values. It seeks to generate and strengthen the capacities and opportunities of communities by empowering them to administer local development.
